comments_since_last_sample.body: News flash , it's the dang desert . It's hot folks , it has been hot there for a great while. They built a concrete and steel city in the desert and they are worried that it's too hot.

Not s single solar panel in sight.
Of course, not. Fossil fuels are practically free. 
A gallon of gas costs merely cents over there.

Love the BBC featuring one woman planting trees in the dessert, while the Jews in Israel have been doing it since the turn of the last century. 
Try to learn from Israel.

Urban heat island. Goats eat the plants. Solar is more expensive than cheap oil, and actually the heat is too much for the panels.
Maybe you should move!
